name: CreateProduct
description:
Creates a new Product, given at least your `PrimitiveName` and `ProductType`.

- [x]  Given `PrimitiveName` is a name for the product to help you recognise it, but is rarely exposed to users or customers. This property does not support localization or translations!
- [x]  `TaxCodeID` is an integer value indicating one of the configured TaxCodes.
- [x]  The `ProductType` is a flag enumeration value with one or more of the following possible values;

  * `0` None
  * `1` Stock
  * `2` Insurance
  * `4` Marketing
  * `8` Gift Card
  * `16` Service
  * `64` Custom Pricing
  * `128` External
  * `256` Order Costs
  * `512` System Generated
  * `1024` Product Set
  * `2048` Bundle Product
  * `16384` Configurable
  * `32768` Supplier Product
  * `65536` Template

Optionally, you can supply some additional information;

- [] `BackendID` is a number to help you identify this product. **Unique per `OrganizationUnitID` and `BackendSystemID`.**
- [] `BackendSystemID` is a string value to idenfity the source this product originated from - can be anything.
- [] `OrganizationUnitID` is the Organization Unit this product is linked to, or `null` when this is a generic EVA product.
- [] `CustomID` is a string value to help you identify this product, without any constraints, but indexed for optimal performance.
- [] `BrandID` to link it to any `Brand` entity.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `Product:Create`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

B.name: BrandID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Brand`

B.name: OrganizationUnitID
B.description: This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

B.name: ProductType
B.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Stock
* `2` - Insurance
* `4` - Marketing
* `8` - GiftCard
* `16` - Service
* `32` - GreetingCard
* `64` - CustomPricing
* `128` - External
* `256` - OrderCosts
* `512` - SystemGenerated
* `1024` - ProductSet
* `2048` - BundleProduct
* `4096` - VirtualProduct
* `8192` - MadeToOrder
* `16384` - Configurable
* `32768` - SupplierProduct
* `65536` - Template
* `131072` - SecondChance
* `262144` - NotReturnable

B.name: TaxCodeID
B.description: This is the ID of a `TaxCode`

D.name: Code
D.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

D.name: Message
D.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

D.name: RequestID
D.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

D.name: Type
D.description: A short description of the error type.

E.name: ExternalIDs
E.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

E.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
E.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

E.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
E.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

C.name: ID
C.description: This is the ID of a `Product`
